org.bukkit.event.block

Class BlockListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bukkit.event.block.BlockListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Listener

    public class BlockListener
extends Object
implements Listener
    Handles all events thrown in relation to Blocks

      • BlockListener

        public BlockListener()
        Default Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • onBlockDamage

        public void onBlockDamage(BlockDamageEvent event)
        Called when a block is damaged by a player.

        If a Block Damage event is cancelled, the block will not be damaged.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockCanBuild

        public void onBlockCanBuild(BlockCanBuildEvent event)
        Called when we try to place a block, to see if we can build it here or not.

        Note:

        • The Block returned by getBlock() is the block we are trying to place on, not the block we are trying to place.
        • If you want to figure out what is being placed, use BlockCanBuildEvent.getMaterial() or BlockCanBuildEvent.getMaterialId() instead.
        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockFromTo

        public void onBlockFromTo(BlockFromToEvent event)
        Represents events with a source block and a destination block, currently only applies to liquid (lava and water).

        If a Block From To event is cancelled, the block will not move (the liquid will not flow).

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockIgnite

        public void onBlockIgnite(BlockIgniteEvent event)
        Called when a block is ignited. If you want to catch when a Player places fire, you need to use BlockPlaceEvent.

        If a Block Ignite event is cancelled, the block will not be ignited.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockPhysics

        public void onBlockPhysics(BlockPhysicsEvent event)
        Called when block physics occurs.
        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockPlace

        public void onBlockPlace(BlockPlaceEvent event)
        Called when a block is placed by a player.

        If a Block Place event is cancelled, the block will not be placed.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockRedstoneChange

        public void onBlockRedstoneChange(BlockRedstoneEvent event)
        Called when redstone changes.
        From: the source of the redstone change.
        To: The redstone dust that changed.
        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onLeavesDecay

        public void onLeavesDecay(LeavesDecayEvent event)
        Called when leaves are decaying naturally.

        If a Leaves Decay event is cancelled, the leaves will not decay.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onSignChange

        public void onSignChange(SignChangeEvent event)
        Called when a sign is changed by a player.

        If a Sign Change event is cancelled, the sign will not be changed.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockBurn

        public void onBlockBurn(BlockBurnEvent event)
        Called when a block is destroyed as a result of being burnt by fire.

        If a Block Burn event is cancelled, the block will not be destroyed as a result of being burnt by fire.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockBreak

        public void onBlockBreak(BlockBreakEvent event)
        Called when a block is broken by a player.

        Note: Plugins wanting to simulate a traditional block drop should set the block to air and utilise their own methods for determining what the default drop for the block being broken is and what to do about it, if anything.

        If a Block Break event is cancelled, the block will not break.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockForm

        public void onBlockForm(BlockFormEvent event)
        Called when a block is formed or spreads based on world conditions. Use BlockSpreadEvent to catch blocks that actually spread and don't just "randomly" form.

        Examples:

        • Snow forming due to a snow storm.
        • Ice forming in a snowy Biome like Tiga or Tundra.

        If a Block Form event is cancelled, the block will not be formed or will not spread.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details
        See Also:
        BlockSpreadEvent

      • onBlockSpread

        public void onBlockSpread(BlockSpreadEvent event)
        Called when a block spreads based on world conditions. Use BlockFormEvent to catch blocks that "randomly" form instead of actually spread.

        Examples:

        • Mushrooms spreading.
        • Fire spreading.

        If a Block Spread event is cancelled, the block will not spread.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockFade

        public void onBlockFade(BlockFadeEvent event)
        Called when a block fades, melts or disappears based on world conditions

        Examples:

        • Snow melting due to being near a light source.
        • Ice melting due to being near a light source.

        If a Block Fade event is cancelled, the block will not fade, melt or disappear.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockDispense

        public void onBlockDispense(BlockDispenseEvent event)
        Called when an item is dispensed from a block.

        If a Block Dispense event is cancelled, the block will not dispense the item.

        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockPistonRetract

        public void onBlockPistonRetract(BlockPistonRetractEvent event)
        Called when a piston retracts
        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details

      • onBlockPistonExtend

        public void onBlockPistonExtend(BlockPistonExtendEvent event)
        Called when a piston extends
        Parameters:
        event - Relevant event details
